docs.lead_paragraph: Millions of women experience vaginal discomfort, and sometimes crippling pain, for a variety of reasons, most often a loss of estrogen . The resulting vaginal dryness and atrophy can make sexual intercourse, a pelvic exam, urinating, or even sitting, walking or cycling a painful nightmare.In addition to women near or past menopause , those affected include women who have recently given birth or are breast-feeding , women treated with estrogen-suppressing drugs for breast cancer or given chemotherapy or pelvic radiation for other cancers, and women whose ovaries were surgically removed.

headline.main: Personal Health: Persistence Is Key to Treating Sexual Pain

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column provides advice for women experiencing vaginal discomfort or pain, widespread condition that can have a severe effect on quality of life. Drawing (M)

headline.main: Persistence Is Key to Treating Sexual Pain
headline.print_headline: Personal Health: Persistence Is Key to Treating Sexual Pain

docs.abstract: Only about one-quarter of women with vaginal pain ever report the problem to a medical professional. And those who do speak up are often told - incorrectly - that nothing can be done.
docs.snippet: Only about one-quarter of women with vaginal pain ever report the problem to a medical professional. And those who do speak up are often told - incorrectly - that nothing can be done.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Olympics, with its long history of doping, would seem to be the last event an expert on performance-enhancing drugs would want to watch.

headline.seo: Savoring Olympic Games, Despite Their History of Doping
headline.main: Enjoying the Games, Despite What May Be Behind the Curtain
headline.print_headline: Enjoying the Games, Despite What May Be Behind the Curtain

docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column notes that Charles Yesalis, who spent nearly 30 years examining the dark side of sports, exploring firsthand the lengths to which athletes will go to get an edge, still enjoys watching the Olympics, despite its long history of doping.
docs.snippet: The Olympics, with its long history of doping, would seem to be the last event an expert on performance-enhancing drugs would want to watch.
